titles.title: Mäṣḥafä ṭomar "Book of the Letter (from Heaven)" / Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus" / Täʾamrä Libanos "Miracles of Libanos"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä ṭomar "The Book of the Letter (from Heaven)" (fols. 2ra-14rv) II) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" (fols. 16ra-22rb, 25ra-213va) II-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah (fols. 16ra-22rb) III) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus": 1 miracle (fols. 22va-23vb). II-2) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki... “I worship Thee..." and hymns (fols. 25ra-28ra) II-3) Introductive exhortation (fols. 28rb-30vb) II-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary": 75 miracles (fols. 31rb-213va) IV) Täʾamrä Libanos "Miracles of Libanos": 8 miracles (fols. 213vb-225vb)
Colophon.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Krǝstos (hand a) is mentioned as the scribe in the colophon. His name is written in supplication formulas (e.g., fols. 43ra, 54rb, 101ra, 109rb, 206ra, 219va, 220rb), but has been often erased and replaced with that of Wäldä Mikaʾel. The name of the scribe, determined as "hand c", has been erased on fol. 204vb; only the second part, Śǝllase, is preserved. Most probably the name is ʾArʾaya Śǝllase.

donors.donor: The parchment (branna) was donated by Wäldä Dawit (s. colophon). He and his wife Ṭǝʿǝmt Maryam were mentioned in supplication formulas (fols. 14rb, 105ra, 140ra, 168ra, 170va, 175ra, 193va, 196ra, 200vb, 201ra, 204rb, 220va). However, their names has been erased in the most cases and replaced with that of Wäldä Mikaʾel. Other persons mentioned are Kǝflä Giyorgis (fol. 109ra), Ḫadärä Giyorgis (fol. 113ra) and Kǝflä Maryam (fols. 189va, 197va). Mälkä Ṣedeq is written in the supplication formulas in Text II-3 and IV in hand b (fols. 20vb, 22va; see also MM-001, fol. 153va).

dcomments.dcomment: Mid 17th - mid 18th cent.(?) Quire III is of more recent time (19th cent).

txstates.txstate: The sewing of the Ms. is damaged, partly missing; it has been crudely repaired (with stitches lead through most of the quires). The Ms. is severely worn (parchment darkened and discoloured, red ink faded).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown leather (for the most part hidden under the secondary textile cover); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

inks.ink: Black, red (hand a: deep reddish brown, hand b and hand c: strong red)

txfolios.txfolio: (225+1) Foliation mistake: the folio after 190 not foliated has been given number 190a.

squires.squire: I(11; s.l.: 9, stub after 2/fols. 1r-11v) – II(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fol. 12r-14v)– <III(10/fols. 15r-24v)> – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(10/fols. 33r-42v) – VI(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 8/fols. 43r-51v) – VII(9; s.l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 52r-60v) – VIII(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 61r-69v) – IX(8/fols. 70r-77v) – X(8/fols. 78r-85v) – XI(10/fols. 86r-95v) – XII(10/fols. 96r-105v) – XIII(8/fols. 106r-113v) – XIV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XV(10/fols. 122r-131v) – ፪XVI(10/fols. 132r-141v) – ፫XVII(10/fols. 142r-151v) – ፬XVIII(10/fols. 152r-161v) – ፭XIX(10/fols. 162r-171v) – ፮XX(12/fols. 172r-181v) – ፯XXI(10/fols. 182r-190av) – ፰XXII (10/fols. 191r-200v) – ፱XXIII(5; s.l.: 4, stub after 1/fols. 201r-205v) – XXIV(10/fols. 206r-215v) – XXV(10/fols. 216r-225v)

taunit.mr-info: Quires I-II, IV-XXV: all data are for fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Qquire III: all data are for fol. 17r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: mid 17th - mid 18th century (?). Hand b: 19th century. Hand c: mid 17th - mid 18th century (?)

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: rather fine. Hand b: mediocre. Hand c: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a, Wäldä Krǝstos: fols. 2ra-14rb, 25ra-117vb, 206ra-222ra; rounded, sometimes irregularly formed, slightly left-sloping letters. Hand b: fols. 16ra-23vb; broadly spaced and angular letters with short hairlines (esp. መ ወ ጽ). Hand c: fols. 118ra-205ra, 222vb-225vb; slight italic script with forked hook vowel markers (ተ ታ ብ ኃ ዚ ጉ ያ). Some letters have short hairlines (መ ን ኃ የ ድ ገ ጉ ጠ).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the original donors and scribes; a few lines on the incipit page of Text II-1, incipit of all other texts; incipit of sections of Texts II-4, III and IV; the words sälam "salutation", täfäśśǝḥi "rejoice" and a few other words (fols. 19vb, 20ra, 25rb, 91rb); elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The miracles of Mary written in hand c (40 miracles) are numbered.
Text II-1 contains: - Excerpt from the Gospel of Matthew (Mt. 25: 1-13) (fols. 21va-22rb).
Text II-2 includes the hymns: - [...] ʾO-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "[...] O my Lady Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fols. 26va-27ra)(cp. ChRep no. 373) - Sälam läki ʾo-ʾәgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan ... " Salutation to you, o my Lady Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 27ra-28ra).
Two worn paper-pictures of St. Mary and St. Joseph are sewn with textile onto fol. 15v.

colophon.tran: Fol. 222rb: I, the sinner Wäldä Krǝstos, wrote this book without reward (but) for the sake of love to Our Lady Mary, so that it might be a guide for me to the Kingdom of Heaven. And the one who gave the parchment to Our Lady Mary is priest Wäldä Dawit, so that She might be the guarantor for her beloved one in the Kingdom of Heaven. May He reward them together like the righteous and martyrs. For ever and ever. Amen and Amen. The one who stole this book from this church or erased (its text) or demeaned its words or robbed it shall be excommunicated by the word of Peter and Paul and also by my word, of the sinful Wäldä Krǝstos. So be it. So be it.
colophon.det: This colophon is repeated in the margins of fol. 117v.

extras.extra: - Musical notation: fol. 21r. - Tämälläs-signs (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols. 28ra l.1, 59vb l.8, 70va l.13, 77vb l.10, 79vb l.10, 81rb l.1. - Some erasures are marked with thin parallel lines: fols. 5vb, 7vb, 8ra, 31va, 37va, 47rb, 59rb, 81vb, 87va, 91rb, 163rb, 169ra, 175rb, 190ara, 200ra, 225rb. - A few corrections are written interlineally: fols. 5ra, 36rb, 65ra, 74ra, 107rb, 116va, 151vb, 170vb, 208ra. - A few corrections are written over erased words and passages: fols. 2vb, 4va, 14rb, 179rb, 185ra, 213ra, 215rab. - Passages referring to the text are crudely written in the upper margin: fols. 73v, 74v, 107v, 108r, 177ra. - Trinitarian formula in a secondary hand: fol. 1vb. - Some vanished letters were rewritten with a pink pen: fols. 25va, 45rb.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the centre upper margin, in fols.: 132r: ፪, 142r: ፫, 152r: ፬, 162r: ፭, 172r: ፮, 182r: ፯, 191r: ፰, 201r: ፱.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts are written in different hands in the upper margin: በጽዮን: fol. 31rb, in pen በብአታ፡ ቤተ: fol. 37rb በልደተ፡ ምን / ዘጽንስታ: fol. 40rb, in pink pen በፍልሰታ: fols. 46ra በኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት: fol. 47vb በአስተርእዮ: fol. 51rb በጼዴንያ: fol. 57va ዘዓንቅዓ: fol. 59ra በቍስቋም: fol. 76ra በበዓለ፡ ልደት: fol. 79rb በአስተርእዮ: fol. 86rb በፍልሰታ: fol. 91va በደቅስዮስ: fol. 93va በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ: fol. 96vb በኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት: fol. 101ra አመ፫፡ ለኅደር: fol. 109ra ዘትንሣኤ: fol. 122ra, in pen በቍስቋም: fol. 134vb ዘአባ፡ ሳሙኤል: fol. 137va በገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ: fol. 140ra በበዓለ፡ ሚካኤል: fol. 142ra በኀዳር፡ ሚካኤል: fol. 144va በሚናስ: fol. 151va ዘዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ነጐድጓድ: fol. 153va በትስብእት: fol. 156vb በደብረ፡ ምጥማቅ: fol. 161va በአባ፡ ገሪማ: fols. 165vb.

frames.frame: Fol. 16r (incipit page of Text II-1): simple coloured (red, black) ornamental bands; floral motifs.
